title.text: Linguistic Structure as Composition and Perturbation

abstractContent.text: This paper discusses the problem of learning language from unprocessed text and speech signals, concentrating on the problem of learning a lexicon.
In particular, it argues fora representation of language in which linguistic parameters like words are built by perturbing a composition of existing parameters.

The power of the representation is demonstrated by several examples in text segmentation and compression, acquisition of a lexicon from raw speech, and the acquisition of mappings between text and artificial representations of meaning.
